meanings.sent1: The metal was forgeable, allowing the blacksmith to shape it easily.
meanings.sent2: The forgeable material could be molded into various tools and weapons.
meanings.sent3: The forgeable metal decided to become a sword instead of a spoon.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as forgeable as clay in the hands of a skilled sculptor.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time is as forgeable as molten metal, shaping our lives.

meanings.definition: Able to be falsified or imitated.
meanings.sent1: The signature on the document was forgeable, raising suspicions of fraud.
meanings.sent2: The painting's signature was forgeable, leading to doubts about its authenticity.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a forgeable clue that cracked the case wide open.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as forgeable as a counterfeit coin, hiding her true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The memories were forgeable, easily altered by the passage of time.
